thread.title: Norway’s Aksel Lund Svindal Wins the Men’s Downhill

author: Sara Germano
title: Norway’s Aksel Lund Svindal Wins the Men’s Downhill
text:
JEONGSEONG, South Korea—Aksel Lund Svindal won the men’s downhill on Thursday, becoming the first Norwegian ever to take gold in the event while the Scandinavian nation became the first country to go 1-2 in 30 years.
At 35, Svindal likely cements his status as the best Alpine skier ever from Norway, eight years since his three-medal performance at the Vancouver Olympics. Since Sochi, Svindal has endured a trifecta of injuries to his meniscus, ACL, and Achilles. His winning run of 1:40.25 just narrowly edged compatriot, Kjetil...
